details: Overview of Database Systems - Understanding the types and purposes of databases.
Relational Databases - Exploring the structure and principles of relational databases.
Introduction to SQL - Learning the basics of Structured Query Language for database manipulation.
Advanced SQL Queries - Diving deeper into complex queries and operations in SQL.
NoSQL Databases - An introduction to non-relational databases and when to use them.
Data Modeling - Understanding how to represent and structure data effectively.
Normalization - Learning the process of organizing data to reduce redundancy.
Indexing and Optimization - Techniques for improving database performance.
Database Security - Overview of common security concerns and how to address them.
Review and Practical Exercise - Applying the week's learning to design a simple database.
Introduction to Data Analysis - Understanding the goals and processes involved.
Data Cleaning - Techniques for identifying and correcting errors in data.
Data Visualization - Learning how to represent data visually for analysis.
Exploratory Data Analysis - Techniques for summarizing and exploring data.
Introduction to Statistical Concepts - Basic statistics used in data analysis.
Advanced Statistical Methods - Learning more complex statistical techniques for deeper analysis.
Predictive Modelling - An introduction to creating models to predict future trends.
Machine Learning for Data Analysis - Overview of using machine learning in data analysis.
Practical Data Analysis Project - Applying the concepts learned to a real-world dataset.
Review and Discussion - Reviewing the project and discussing further learning paths.
